info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 12 at 2:23PM MDT until July 12 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE CERRO PELADO BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL COUNTY... At 223 PM MDT, satellite estimates indicate thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Vallecitos Creek, Paliza Canyon, West Fork Borrego Canyon, Vallecitos de los Indios, and East Fork Trailhead. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. SOURCE...Satellite estimates. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Cerro Pelado Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jemez Pueblo and Ponderosa. This includes the following recreation areas... Jemez Falls Campground and Paliza Campground. FLASH FLOOD...SATELLITE INDICATED
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Cerro Pelado burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
